reviewText:
Product received for free

You're a wizard. You're in a tower.

Beyond that? Whatever you do is up to you.

Mix some ingredients. Make a spell! Throw fireballs, grow to gigantic size. Telekinetically move things around WITH MAGIC!

Its free. Its amazing. There's plenty to do. Just play it. Its great.

reviewText:
Amazing experience! It looks very polished and I had fun for an hour that felt like minutes. And all for free!
Compare this to the many VR techdemos that actually want money...

I would love to pay for a version of this with more content!

reviewText:
Put on headset, turned on WOW to check it out.  Take off headset... 64 minutes played.  Felt all of maybe 20 minutes at most.

Making potions to get magical powers was cool.  When I picked up the spy glass and looked through it and... It worked, I was stunned.
Shot the giant with the crossbow, then flung a fireball at him the enxt time he appeared.
Did the snowglobe portals, loved the one with the shield and weapon of choice!
Favorite spell was Conductor.  I expected lightning, instead got even better magic spell!

Hit the Knight with an object?  He throws it back!

I did a bunch of stuff, wonder if I missed things, and hope for more!
this game is a must get for vr it is immersive and enjoyable and best of all its free

reviewText: The game itself is well worth the free download. It's a simple premise, you're a wizard in a tower with the ability to mix ingredients to create various spells. It's a great way to spend some time playing around and it is hands down one of the best ways to introduce a friend to VR. Graphically it is beautiful with intuitive controls and again, it's free - why not?
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: You\'re a Wizard Harry, assuming thats your name anyway.\n\nThis game/experience/adventure/fantasy was absolutely MAGICAL! I had a blast exploring all the different hidden things throughout this wonderfully designed VR game. Waltz of the Wizard is highly immersive, beautifully designed, and coated in magic! It only takes about 30 minutes to explore everything this game has to offer, but for FREE? Please don\'t pass this up! You will thank me for telling you to take a few extra MB of space on your hard-drive to try Waltz of the Wizard out.

reviewText: The coolest VR game out... and its FREE! This game is amazing! Made me laugh and simply enjoy and have fun. Hurling fireballs at objects, pretending to be a wizard. All thats missing is owning a real wizards hat to make this a full experience. So off to buy one, in the meantime, GET THIS GAME NOW!

This is one of the best VR experiences, comparable to the Lab. It has it all: Nice graphics, excellent hand interaction, engaging game-play, surprising secrets, amazing atmosphere that can go from wonderful to scary and back in an instant while feeling very natural. Also I never felt this powerful in any other VR game, truly awesome. And it is free. What more could one want from it ? Nothing, besides to wish it was longer.

Product received for free

This game is free. As such we asks ourselves the question: Is it really worth the time?

If you are anything like me and love to play around in VR throwing objects, using swords and experimenting in general you NEED to try Waltz of the Wizard. It is short and its not a full game but anyone who expects it to be any more than what it already is is either a child who doesn't understand the world or a delusional adult.

VR is still in its early days and when we are paying up to 30€ for 2-3 hour experiences one can only admire Waltz of the Wizard for its generosity. Do yourself a favour and spend some time in Waltz of the Wizard, you won't regret it.
Product received for free\n\nIt's so much fun. I love it :)
A really fun little sandbox game with a lot of charm. Absolutely worth giving it a go.
Absolutely phenomenal VR experience. Incredibly polished, especially for a free title.
This is so cool, maybe short but it\'s free and you loose yourself in it.
I\'ve never posted a review before, but this was compelling. One of the best experiences out there right now. It\'s a must have in your library.

Fantastic VR experience. I had a really fun experience just marveling at what I could do, giggling with childish wonder. The graphics are very charming and clearly quality. Imagining a full-blown game done like this is a tantalizing peek into the future of VR.

Waltz of the Wizard takes the feel of Secret Shop and combines it with the interactivity of Job Simulator. The result is a mesmerizing experience that has had me come back multiple times just to mess around with all the items in the room.

There is so much that goes on in the tower and so many little “hidden” secrets that I often got distracted (in a good way) from making all the spells.  However, I do feel that there is also a lot of untapped potential here (especially for people with larger play areas) with all the unused items in the room. (or maybe I just haven’t figured out how to use them yet!)  It would be amazing to see some of the various trinkets and artifacts be used elsewhere in the room to unlock new areas or abilities.

As it stands, Waltz of the Wizard is a fantastic experience and is of an amazing quality for a freebie.  It truly makes you feel a bit like Mickey in the Sorcerer’s Apprentice and it genuinely captures the feeling of actually wielding magical powers!

10/10, will play again!

I am super impressed by how polished this is, especially for a free game! There were so many unexpected things tucked away in different corners, and everything I tried to interact with actually responded in some way. The last thing I did was hold the slightly annoying talking skull in the cauldron out of spite, and he even started gurgling under the water. Be sure to try out all the alternate realms as well (the ones you access through the xylophone thing). One of them is particularly interesting.\n\nThanks for the great free experience, devs!
Try it, you\'ll like it!
It is basically a bunch of tech demo concepts but it is fun and free so no reason to not check it out if you have a Vive.

This was one of the titles that convinced me to get a Vive in the first place. Seeing early dev videos put this on my wishlist long before my headset even shipped. I\'ve really got to hand it to the devs pushing this out for free too.\n\nThe gameplay mostly involves adding 6 different alchemy ingredients to your cauldron in order to produce a magic spell which can then be commanded using the motion controllers. Everything from fireballs to telekinesis. There\'s a few extra bits here and there but discovering them for yourself is half the fun. Give it a spin and you won\'t be disappointed.
This is a fantastic experience in the Vive. It is now one of my favorites. I would gladly pay for this even though it is available for free.
Amazing experience. Really demonstrates what VR will do to gaming in the future!

I have only played a very short amount of this game, but the first two powers I got were Conductor and Fireball that is pretty much exactly what I was hoping for out of a wizard game. I also got to a secret room (of which I hear there are many) and it was amazing.\n\nFor a free game this is a must play VR game - equal to the Budget Cuts demo.
Short. Sweet. Immersive. Well made. Free.\n\nWhy are you still reading this? Try it!

Holy moly, this is one of the best things released for the VIVE yet, and somehow it's free? If the massivly positive reviews aren't enough, do yourself a favor and download this immediately.\n\nThis is right up there with The Blu and The Lab for introducing new people to VR.
You must try this free demo because it is a very cool experiment.\nIt contains many nice ideas that VR games can borrow, such as ideas about controller mechanics.
You can be a wizard and trow fireball from your hands, this is an awesome and fun experience.\n\nThis is the perfect demo for people experiencing VR for the first time.

One of the standouts though would be the little insights of mysterious places, there is a hidden away rift under the table and it is by far the most interesting one.\n\nIt\'s free and runs great and it\'s super neat. It\'s mega short though, but still quality over quantity. Hopefully there\'s DLC or something.

First off, yep, another Vive tech demo. However, I have to say this was one of the best uses of VR I've experienced so far. If you've ever wanted to straight up feel like you're in X-Men, this is for you. The powers are amazing and creative, and the few locations you can experience are tense. I would have been happy to pay for this, but it being free only sweetens the deal. Here's hoping for something full length I can throw money at!

Great tech demo & VR experience!! I would've gladly paid a small price to buy this.

I would love to see many of the elements in here put into a game setting.

I would like to be able to move around the room a bit more, outside of giant mode.

Bug: Throwing Skully McSkullface out the window appears to crash the windows client? You can keep messing around but he never teleports back.
Fantastic experience, a must have for every Vive owner!
small free game showing so many cool things VR can do

Awesome!!! A couple of the spells are lame; a couple of them are just unbelievably AWESOME! One spell in particular made me feel like a true wizard that I have watched on TV my whole life. Its FREE so Download now!
This game gave, at moments, the feeling of controlling the element.  This has been the most immersive experience I've played in VR yet. Very well made.  Crashed when I tried to quit though.

Probably the best demo of what the HTC Vive is capable of so far.
Much like The Lab, it's more of a tech demo than an actual game, but dang if it isn't really cool!

Plus, it's free!  How can you go wrong?  You.  Have an HTC Vive?  Download this now!
Amazing and first game to really get me nervous in VR if only for a few seconds...  Keep updating guys this one is fun and love the talking skull!
Ur a wizard Harry!

Incredible game. There is so much depth and it really makes you feel like a wizard. If you haven't already DON'T WATCH THE VIDEO OR SCREENSHOTS ABOVE, they ruin some cool moments that would be better expereinved for the first time while in vr.

AWESOME. If you have a Vive then do not pass up this title. What a great sandbox showing what great things we can do for the VIVE. I would personally like to thank the developers for spending their time and effort making this and donating it to the community for Free. Has to be one of the best free titles out right now. The reviews speak for themselves though it would appear that 1 in every 100 reviewers are stupid and ungrateful. They should be thrown in a cauldron and turned into frog spawn soup. PS make sure you find the 3 xylophone tunes and copy them to teleport to different realms!
This 'experience' needs to become a game!
This is awesome. Like most of these VR titles there should be more to it but i still love it
I've just now created a new category in my library. 'Worthy VR Demos'\n\nMore content and of a much higher standard than some paid experiences.

+ Excellent performance
+ Great VR showcase
+ Never ran into edge of playspace
+ Environments are detailed and fun to explore

This feels like a natural extention to Harry Potter. Created many potions and traveled outside the lab via globes. There is a great feature that shows the FPS inside the menu screen.

An absolute must-download!  It's the best free experience for the Vive other than The Lab and some demos (Brookhaven Experiment, Budget Cuts).  I probably wouldn't have paid for it since it's not really a game, but I definitely would not have minded if there was some advertisement.

Absolutely great!

This game is a lot of fun and visually great especially for an initial VR game.

Best spell imo is the Conductor :)
Ever wanted to feel like you had telekensis then get this!

Amazing VR experience, especially for a free game. Very well done and immersive. I just hope it can one day be turned into an actual game rather than the relatively short (but great) experience it currently is.
This game shouldn't be free, it's just so good. Use a cauldron to create spells, travel to other realms, experience magic first-hand.\n\nWow, just wow.
This 'experience' needs to become a game!
This needs to be made into a full-fledged game. Felt great all the way through!

The best VR experience currently available, and completely, unbelievably, free. I keep coming back to find more things to discover, and it's always a big hit when doing demos. It awes, delights, and frightens in equal measures, but most of all it makes you incredibly hopeful for the future of VR.\n\nThere's nothing else like it.
